posts.post_content: It's cool if you have something to destroy enchantments and with treefolk thats bound to happen. posts.post_content:
This card is so cool to me, but disappointing too. It sucks that Colfenor's Plans counts as the first spell of the turn, and it really hurts to lose all your cards if it gets removed.  
  
The upside is that it can be some fun in casual against slower decks. I played this in a U/B deck with some counterspells for their turn, [Jester's Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jester's Scepter), [Muse Vessel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Muse Vessel), and some weird possession spells. [Recoil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Recoil) and other blue control spells kept me in the game for quite a few turns. [Bloodletter Quill](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodletter Quill) drew me some extra cards.  
  
It can be helpful to dig for that [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation) or [Evacuation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evacuation) you need to stay alive.  
  
And, you can always run [Perilous Research](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Research) to get rid of your Colfenor's Plans and draw some cards. How about [Dream Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dream Stalker) to refresh the Plans?   
  
It didn't last long, but oh well - why miss out on trying a quirky mechanic here an... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This card is so cool to me, but disappointing too. It sucks that Colfenor's Plans counts as the first spell of the turn, and it really hurts to lose all your cards if it gets removed.

The upside is that it can be some fun in casual against slower decks. I played this in a U/B deck with some counterspells for their turn, Jester's Scepter, Muse Vessel, and some weird possession spells. Recoil and other blue control spells kept me in the game for quite a few turns. Bloodletter Quill drew me some extra cards.

It can be helpful to dig for that Damnation or Evacuation you need to stay alive.

And, you can always run Perilous Research to get rid of your Colfenor's Plans and draw some cards. How about Dream Stalker to refresh the Plans?

It didn't last long, but oh well - why miss out on trying a quirky mechanic here an... (see all)

posts.post_content: You could look at this card as gaining a huge card advantage (by black standards), and then suffering for that advantage. The price to pay is great, but seven extra cards is pretty awesome. Plus, as said by Tommy9898, [sapling of colfenor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sapling of colfenor) can help in its ability to allow you to continue to draw cards. Mid-game, the card advantage granted by this card could be pretty influential. Imagine having two of these out! So many options! Just saying, it deserves more than 2 stars in my opinion for the card advantage it grants...

posts.post_content:
This could have some interesting mechanics with [Maralen of the Mornsong](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maralen of the Mornsong), [Sapling of Colfenor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sapling of Colfenor), and [Leaf-Crowned Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leaf-Crowned Elder).   
  
Turn 3 you play Maralen of the Mornsong, then next turn you grab [Colfenor's Plans](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Colfenor's Plans) from your library and toss it out. Next turn grab Sapling of Colfenor, then toss it out or Leaf-Crowned Elder. Sapling of Colfenor basically counteracts Maralen of the Mornsong's life loss, and Leaf-Crowned Elder lets you play Treefolk off the top of your deck for free. Once you're tired of Colfenor's Plans, you toss out a [Spring Cleaning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spring Cleaning) and remove it and your opponents enchantments. If you have an [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening) in play you would wipe out all of their permanents too. This is all just Lorwyn-Moningtide block though; I haven't played much with Treefolk.  
  
Of course this is the ideal early situation, and hopefully your opponent hasn't gained too much of an edge w... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This could have some interesting mechanics with Maralen of the Mornsong, Sapling of Colfenor, and Leaf-Crowned Elder.

Turn 3 you play Maralen of the Mornsong, then next turn you grab Colfenor's Plans from your library and toss it out. Next turn grab Sapling of Colfenor, then toss it out or Leaf-Crowned Elder. Sapling of Colfenor basically counteracts Maralen of the Mornsong's life loss, and Leaf-Crowned Elder lets you play Treefolk off the top of your deck for free. Once you're tired of Colfenor's Plans, you toss out a Spring Cleaning and remove it and your opponents enchantments. If you have an Enchanted Evening in play you would wipe out all of their permanents too. This is all just Lorwyn-Moningtide block though; I haven't played much with Treefolk.

Of course this is the ideal early situation, and hopefully your opponent hasn't gained too much of an edge w... (see all)

This is not bad !

In mid game this is card advantage for sure but you have to win quick !
